snippet: The ruling by the New York City medical examiner in the case of a mentally ill veteran who died in an overheated cell at Rikers Island raises questions of culpability in the case.
abstract: New York City medical examiner's office rules that February 2014 death of mentally ill veteran Jerome Murdough in overheated cell at Rikers Island was accidental; ruling raises questions of culpability in the case.
lead_paragraph: The ruling by the New York City medical examiner in the case of a mentally ill veteran who died in an overheated cell at Rikers Island raises questions of culpability in the case.

headline.main: Inmate’s Death in Overheated Rikers Cell Is Ruled Accidental
headline.print_headline: Inmate’s Death in Overheated Rikers Cell Is Ruled Accidental

keywords.value: Office of the Chief Medical Examiner of the City of New York
keywords.name: organizations
